catastrophes.name: Heartbleed
catastrophes.description: Missing bounds check in TLS heartbeat extension allowed reading 64k of server memory. Affected 66% of HTTPS servers.
catastrophes.verification_notes: Fix commit verified via GitHub API on 2026-01-14. Commit message explicitly mentions CVE-2014-0160.

catastrophes.name: PwnKit
catastrophes.description: Local privilege escalation via pkexec. Vulnerability existed for 12+ years - classic systemic/architectural flaw where code assumed argc >= 1.
catastrophes.verification_notes: Fix commit verified via GitLab API on 2026-01-14. Commit title explicitly mentions CVE-2021-4034.

catastrophes.name: Log4Shell
catastrophes.description: JNDI injection via log messages. Affected virtually every Java application. Attacker could execute arbitrary code by getting app to log a malicious string.
catastrophes.verification_notes: Fix commit verified via GitHub API on 2026-01-14. Commit message: LOG4J2-3201 - Limit the protocols JNDI can use.
